RvUjwSCcHCRPvIdti4sBqg.text: Love this place! Fantastic service and amazing food. The GM Shane is so welcoming! I highly recommend the beef and kimchi dumplings, the com chien and the strawberry wontons. Also, don't be afraid of the hot sauce. It is amazing.

5afAp4mHgIPg0WTp2mjfEQ.text: If I could leave a review with no stars I absolutely would . Long story short THERE WAS A HAIR IN MY FOOD AGAIN !!!!!  DO NOTAND I REPEAT DO NOT GO TO THIS FRAUD ASIAN RESTAURANT.  I went in yesterday to order the some Fried Rice and Thai Green Curry . I ordered the rice in the kids portion because the regular portion is just too big . The rice took over 20 minutes to come out . When it did I had to send it back because all of the TOFU was carcinogenic! Not to mention we got the Thai Green curry came out before everything and we ordered it 15 minutes after everything.  Now the icing on the cake was when I got the food and got to the bottom of my bowl to realize the was a small brown hair . Completely disgusted. This is the third time I've seen this happen here ... never to me but overhearing other people . I guess the manager a very unpleasant and sleezily dressed Asian woman SOO , saw me take a picture of the food and the assistant manager to ask me not to return to the restaurant. Someone call the health inspector if this is how they do business. GO TO YAMA wayyy better food , better staff , and better health rating!

m6ERZs2M_pWkMFBdFieDLg.text: This place is ok. However, we found a paper order in our takeout pad thai, which had other guest's name on it. I had a bite and it was ultimately disgusting when we found out what in the mouth was actually a paper order!

photos.caption: Photo of CO - Charlotte, NC, United States

IaN3n9w0hF3TGCGo5RUI-w.text: Happy hour was packed! A lot of people were getting half an hour wait times. It was so packed we had to share a six top table with two other people. We were very nervous because we got sat 5 minutes before happy hour was over. Thank goodness our waitress was very nice, helpful and fast. We got our orders put in before it ended. There is also a small sheet for appetizers that are also half price I believe that you can order during this time as well. We got several items including the bao bun, tuna tacos, tuna tataki, dumplings,  katsu chicken slider, warty roll, super crunch roll, lemon salmon roll, Kobe beef roll, rainbow roll etc.  I didn't really enjoy the super crunch roll because it was laid in a red sauce in a bowl that tasted like hot sauce to me and I just didn't think it mixed well with that roll. Hot sauce on my raw fish just isn't my thing. Either the pork belly roll or the Kobe roll also had a sauce I didn't really care for. The Wagyu I was disappointed with because for being cooked it was very chewy and upon asking I was informed that it was not Japanese Wagyu but American Wagyu.  Overall though I had a good experience and left satisfied. We got to look at the menu beforehand so when we got sat we ordered everything we wanted. There is no limit to how much you can order at a time. We were also able to bring home our last roll free of charge. I'm not really sure how she explained it worked but ask before you order and assume.

RMPziKmZl6byjQZ3l_Q2fA.text: Service was excellent and the food was delicious. I wasn't sure what to expect (didn't check Yelp beforehand, shockingly) and we thoroughly enjoyed it! We had the Edamame gyoza, Jersey and Buddha rolls (both great) and spicy udon with chicken.

Ew5ZfQtVSPAVvQ_i069FLA.text: We have been going to CO since Waverly was opened. We have seen ups and downs in the service that was initially acceptable as they became established.  Unfortunately, it has consistently underwhelmed. Only exception is a bartender named Peter who consistently has been excellent. I'm not sure he even works there anymore though.  I recommend other options for your dining experience, including for take outs until they get an experienced and professional service staff. I hope they can turn things around as the food has been consistently good.

OQfvYyaY5cmR8OGy-5A_6g.text: The hostess on tonight was incredibly friendly and helpful! she was very receptive to my requests for seating & also quick to answer any questions. the wait staff was equally as accommodating 10/10

Q1wuGAX-xJMakJhiYf6J5A.text: Went to lunch today and we were the only ones in there.  This is the second time we have tried it and we are even less impressed than the first one.  Family in Dilworth rave about the Co nearby, so we decided to try again.  We ordered the pork and crab spring rolls - so brown and crispy they were almost burned and had absolutely no taste.  The spicy crab rangoon was very good.  I ordered the drunken noodles and they were very salty, bland and so dry they were gummy.  My husband ordered the Thai Green Curry and it looked beautiful with grilled veggies over rice, but was also very salty and not very tasty.  After a few bitres we asked for our check. Yama, around the corner, is always excellent.  Vietnam Grille on South Blvd. is also great, but we won't be going back to CO.

OR9AtH0fH2MHPvIHxTnRbw.text: First time there. The food was good but the portion was modest. Could have been slightly more and this includes the appetizers. The setting is nice but it is loud at times. Our waiter did an adequate job but could have checked in more (there was not a lot of people) and I probably would have bought another beer. We will try it again but don't recommend right now.

83SVAsoIc-0uxtagy5OUoQ.text: I didn't realize there was a second branch of CO, so I had to go and check it out! This was much smaller, and less fancier than the original location, but had much more comfy seating arrangements (less high tops as in the other location). I walked in rather early (11 amish?), so had first dibs on seats and service...both of which proved to be excellent! I ordered the Curry Laksa again, and it's so obvious why this is their signature dish! It's just all-out yummy!! The flavor of the broth is just heavenly, and comes with a ton of fresh greens. I must complain however...that it did not include any shrimp, but I was charged the same amount. Normally, this would tick me off enough to drop a star or two...not to mention me doing some griping to the waitress. However, I decided not to make a fuss, given how amazing good this was (again)...with or without the shrimp. Not sure if maybe this particular location didn't include the shrimp or what, but if this happens again, I WILL ask about this on my next visit.  Anyway, so glad to know that there's this second location, closer to home for me!

photos.caption: Photo of CO - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Curry Laksa&#34; (What happened to the Shrimp?)

qC4V-Kb93gBmOMrAEcPHzg.text: Very disappointed. Came here a week ago. It's fairly pricey and the food was not good at all. Server struggled throughout service and was not busy at all. Won't be back anytime soon.

LSx_4ltscwZsgM5ToZmP4w.text: This was our 3rd time to CO, the first two the food was amazing, but the service wasn't the best. Tonight we sat on the patio and I was skeptical about how we would be served, but our server David was fantastic. Our food was out quickly and he gave us excellent recommendations. The Tuna Tataki was incredible along with the Beef and Kimchi Dumplings.

yT_1PPBCUo2uKLpneS_HIg.text: Great Asian restaurant, the atmosphere is beyond standard, the food is so so, and I would come back for the experience. Their focus is more on the noodles than anything else, and I do like their Hanoi Noodle. Their service is good, and host is friendly. I would recommend people to try for the experience.

hE_bHj9A_SQsqJLpwFxK5A.text: We love this place. Best kept secret in South Charlotte !!! If you go, you have to ask for Chelsea, she is awesome. She has been our waitress twice now and she is amazing ! Great place, great atmosphere, great food, and the service is terrific !!!

4_KIgUQeeggOI_uDbzkE4w.text: I love the Park  Road location, both food and service and was so looking forward to Co in Waverly. Tonight was my 3rd visit to Waverly and most disappointing. The food was tasty and well prepared....but the service was lackluster, food debris on floor and seat on the red banquette seat and dirty dishes left on table. Sanitation rating was 93, concerning in a sushi restaurant.  Every time the door opened we would get a blast if icy cold air.  The design of the entrance door is mid seating area and the hostess station is off in the corner.  This place badly needs some kind of sally port to separate the entrance from the dining area and the hostess station needs to be near the door... who designed this?  Park  Road is so efficient and beautiful this looks like you enter the restaurant by a side door

NJxGgO2yAX3P1nJIozoVcw.text: Finally!   Another CO closer to home in Charlotte.   I love eating at the Park Rd location, now there is another option for South Charlotte.    Opening night I took a group of friends who aren't much into diverse food and they really loved it.    The food was on point, exactly as the Park Rd location.  We had assorted apps and my favorite Pad Thai.   The place has some really cool design features...I love the wood ceiling and antiqued mirrors inside.    Some of the staff were in training as it is a new location and to be expected.    We had a great time and will definitely be returning soon.

NT49dsWuDsp2msAu7ONRYA.text: Food was amazing. Server, Nikki, was attentive and had great advice for selections.  The patio was a great place to enjoy a fall day. The Singapore hot sauce is delish!

GdlTVwPJsNqZKpi4NZ2k8w.text: I don't normally leave reviews, but I was blown away by the service and saw all the poor reviews about service so I thought I would share my experience.  I'm currently dairy/soy free because I'm breastfeeding and my little one is allergic.  I ordered sushi and asked them to make it dairy/soy free.  I was expecting the normal "sure", but who knows and servers/restaurants typically don't care or they just avoid things like soy sauce and don't check the actual ingredients.  Not here!! The server spoke to the chef and he came out and went through all the ingredients that had it and told me what he was going to do instead to make sure I liked it.  Wow! I was blown away that they took it seriously and took the time to come out and explain it to me (and it was busy).  Then..  I'm that girl.. I hit my glass and it shattered everywhere.  They were great cleaned it up quickly with a smile and asked if I wanted another one.  Good service/good food!

Cty62HJ0Pc-9oPOzVUBGGA.text: Flavor is really simple. Food doesn't feel fresh at all. Very grease and service very poor. I really hope CO improves its service and flavor. Not recommended.

rQ3tRlX6zyCEUiRMbD_hrA.text: Amazing food, so healthy and fresh. The service is so great here. I have had Nikki serve me a couple of times and I love her! I'll come back again and again.

JD-JlL_ynJZ5Vekym5TBBw.text: Wow what a great meal.  We had the small plates.  The curry shrimp was fantastic enough for 2.  The tuna tacos were outstanding! Great area to sit outside.  Attentive service. Was here opening night.  Huge improvement in service

45-nebZxzb77MI8qbZ33Xg.text: We tried CO for the first time tonight. Don't be afraid to share the plates. The beef dumplings were great. We will definitely be back. Great place!

-9SoSqzSlqpQidHzbUCgJA.text: Great food and the service was amazing. John did a great job. Great place to eat and the happy hour menu is perfect.

G7nkGKGx2R5Y7vR8YunxbQ.text: Curry Laksa, Tuna Tataki Roll and Strawberry Springroll dessert keep me coming here every time since the store has opened

Y4Q1TO0aE6Iusmv4vVyiIw.text: Pretty average fast food Asian - disguised as a real restaurant. Chicken shredded and placed on dishes, same with shrimp, curry's are the same for all meals. Nothing has been really cooked from scratch for your meal - it is just a sauce with stuff added on. Sushi is just average - not worth going here for sushi. Pho Real is much better and that is a chain!!

amllg7mUSCp5TFo1MsD-bg.text: Mediocre service, rarely came to the table. Took 5 minutes to seat us when there were at least 4 tables in sight open. Food was okay, definitely tasted better. Asked for a box and a check, took the waiter 15 minutes to bring those out, took him 10 minutes just to swipe my card. Not going back that's for sure. Oh yeah, and the seats are extremely uncomfortable. I have back problems, and seats with low backs like that KILL ME. Restaurants need to stop doing that, no matter how trendy it looks.

6b2v031nZWhjAHBKaKWlbQ.text: My husband and I came on a Friday night to try it out. Having read about lackluster service from a couple of reviews, we were skeptical.  But, I have to say it was really great.  Our server "Tori D. " was 99.9% the factor. In this review. In our experience, especially with a grand opening of any restaurant, the food can be the best ever but it's the 'growing pains' that can have a negative effect on a business. Tori's hard work and excellent job combined with the explosion of flavor in the food what won us over. We had the beer & kimchi dumplings the edamame gyoza the Korean rice bowl and the super crunch roll. Dumplings were amazing and gyoza id give an A-. Great flavor and broth on gyoza was to die for. The rice bowl had the sunny side up egg and spicy kimchi so people looking for this will absolutely love it. Super crunch roll was something I could eat every day. Wow. Great food and a wait staff like her will bring us back! Favorite item - "Super Crunch" roll.

photos.caption: Photo of CO - Charlotte, NC, United States. Need &amp; kimchi dumplings
Photo of CO - Charlotte, NC, United States. Edamame gyoza
Photo of CO - Charlotte, NC, United States. Super crunch roll

rW0dYnPTgapItOJ5Uljq4A.text: Had high hopes for this place.  Went on Friday 10/6.  Seemed totally chaotic from the moment we walked in, but no problem, it's a new restaurant.  After waiting 45 minutes for a table and seeing other seated ahead of us who came in after us, again no problem, we were at the bar.  Drinks were OK.  The beer tap lines were new, so the beer had an off taste.  At least the bartender recommended getting bottled beer instead.  Mixed drinks were premixed in large containers.  With the number of places serving fresh made cocktails, found this a bit weird for the prices of the drinks, but understand the reason for it.  Wines OK and they pour into a small carafe to measure which is good (even though at the table someone ordered wine and it came back at about half the pour.  It was sent back since another person got the correct pour.  Not sure if someone was trying to rip us off or just made a mistake).  Then after being seated, wow, getting drinks near impossible, getting a real napkin or silverware, impossible.  Served water in styrofoam cups, are you kidding me.   Appetizers came, but without utensils and plates the food got cold.  At this point we were laughing.  We even joked about ordering a Papa John's pizza for delivery, but who would of thought we really could have.  Tried talking to the waiters or managers.  Nothing.  Then half our food came out, but not the rest and we seek out the manager again and the owner.  By asking where our food was for a third time, the owner tells us we are out of line and should just take our business elsewhere.  It's not so funny any more when they start insulting the customer.  Terrible service.  The manager and owner are both extremely rude.  Food we received was OK, but way too many restaurants serving similar food in Charlotte.  We will never eat here again and will never go to an establishment with the same owner.  Just awful, Waverly and South Charlotte deserve much better than this place.  Had issues at Ted's Montana Grill next door a couple of times and its great manager handled it perfectly with class and respect.  Not so, here, give your dollars elsewhere.

I30sxMA39PTC0Y6MaM_V4w.text: Great Asian fusion offering.  Really enjoyed the food, atmosphere and the service is fantastic.  Chelsea is terrific- she had great recommendations for every one of our visits.

JQoiPGhKlElYapdAowrdcA.text: We eat here about once a week. It has a chill atmosphere and a versatile menu. Strongly recommend it!

P9MyGNhYnGKJRgCecaiJYA.text: Ive been wanting to try this place for a while, and today I finally went and was not  disappointed! Drinks hit the spot after a long week of work, and the sushi was fresh AF! The manager, Luis, stopped by multiple times to make sure we were taken care of. 10/10 would recommend! Will be returning as soon as I can. Thabks again, luis

4PpceELHe0OA4e0YBYWWNA.text: Great food and service. I was told to go for poke, and I went during dinner when they don't have the menu for that out. Once I asked the waitress, she said most people order that for lunch but happily brought us the menu to order. It was fresh and filling, after getting our check she offered us to-go cups for our drinks which I super appreciate. I'll definitely be back to try more items on the menu!

4X8Wh1HEQizmmL3weLrb_w.text: The food is very, very good across the board. Really enjoy the sushi, the dumplings and the spicy pho. It's a bit pricey but not outrageous. Service has been consistently poor, but has trended upward - it was horrible at first. In a nutshell, the food was good enough that we came back hoping the service would improve - it doesn't seem to be the servers themselves - the problem seems to be that the restaurant is consistently understaffed. Expect long waits for seating, service, and food, even if it doesn't appear  busy.   One huge plus for the service - a waitress gave my group a detailed explanation regarding potential traces of shellfish across their menu. As someone with an allergy, it was really refreshing to see someone treat it seriously.   Update: went back due to the managers response to this review. It was our worst experience yet :/

nWuIyB8OHUAGUZtSbGrCxw.text: Food is good. Service is not good. They run you out the door long before closing time.  Sadly, this location is far from the Park Rd or Charleston location.

tMuAbUDrAEcvnjREfznIkA.text: I stopped in last night to celebrate my birthday.  There were only two of us, and when we approached the hostess, she was on her phone.  We asked about the wait, and she quoted us 40 minutes.  I gave her my information, and asked if she would be texting me when the table was ready.  Her condescending response, combined with the look she gave me, was so incredibly rude, it was enough for me to walk out with no intention of ever going back.  I'm disappointed, I had been looking forward to this restaurant as a fun addition to the Waverly shopping center.

IRhrtYQ2lbVZ6juuszv0bA.text: Sitting at the bar is ideal. We go during off hours to enjoy the sake and rolls. All the appetizers are slamming.

dCJoe6DC60LKirHBklD6ZQ.text: Food and drinks are good. Happy hour specials are good. Probably better for a happy hour with friends or casual date night for drinks. Not exactly kids friendly and the layout is weird. Servers are attentive but the hostesses appear somewhat indifferent to be working. Has potential with the food and drinks

ctL088dbVK4yPin5nR3e_A.text: Terrible customer service. Hostess was very rude. Staff doesn't appear to have been trained on any customer service. 3rd time trying we are moving on.

DhMKUTPkhuMk2Yax1MQlzw.text: I dream about the dumplings and Vietnamese Ramen. So glad they opened one closer to me. I love this place

photos.caption: Photo of CO - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork Belly Roll.., ahhhh mazing
Photo of CO - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vietnamese Ramen... so damned good I want bathe in it

6hy6LKYjbIF2cUpNRnS7qA.text: Food was excellent but I have to agree with all the comments about the service.  The waiters don't know how to serve, they are inexperienced and clueless. We asked about the  $3 margarita special that was advertised and he didn't know about the specials.  We showed up at 530 and weren't informed about the happy hour  prices.    Food however was awesome.  Pork belly buns, tuna tacos, firecracker roll and edamame were excellent.  Wish we had tried the Coconut curry

DzGmbB1s6DMI8c_123Y7eg.text: Food was great.  But all the seats are impacted by the door opening and closing too much.  The bar area is secluded,  but the seats get a blast of cold air while you are eating.  Too bad, because the food was great.

MXUxx6H6-gVKSfTKlllfmw.text: Excellent meal and service on a Friday night. Our server, Cody, was well versed on the menu and very attentive. He had solid recommendations, pineapple sake and pork tacos, which were a great addition to the sushi we ordered. The noise level was a bit loud (smaller place) but not overbearing. Would definitely recommend and will be going back!

Jke6ImNtZqWiczjo_TawlQ.text: The food here is great. However the service is terrible. If you want a great Asian fusion restaurant, go to Co, but definitely not this location. Opt for the Park Rd location instead. Last night at Co I can identify singularly as one of my worst dining experiences I've ever had period. Like I said the food and drinks are great, but the service is frankly insufficient. Nobody gave us menus when we sat down, we had to ask for them. After asking for our menus we waited 20 minutes before we asked if we could order drinks, another 20 minutes before again, WE asked if we could order food. Food took about 30 minutes to prepare. However, they were very busy so I'll be forgiving in regards to that.   While sitting at the bar I noticed that the jar of blackberries had mold growing in it, which working in the fine restaurant business before I realize can happen. Sometimes you get a shipment in that already has something growing in it maybe at the bottom where you don't see it. I alerted the bartender/waitress that there was mold growing in the jar, and that I wasn't grossed out but others might be. She actually ignored me the first time I said it, and after alerting her again she made zero eye contact with me and just removed the jar from the top of the bar to behind the bar on the shelf. Never once thanking me for catching that or even apologizing for that.   I like this place's food so I wish that they would do well. But if they don't improve in their service especially on our side of town, they unfortunately won't do well. People talk and right know nobody's saying good things about this Co location. (Park Rd rocks)

mTiv8yw9uxVXwUgH8PS1Ig.text: This is a mixed review.    The bad: They forgot the steak in my Korean bowl.  Manager was rude.  Veggies in our mixed dishes were almost raw.  I like al dente but these were just barely blanched.  Manager was rude.  Oops did I repeat that?  Good: Hostess and server were great.  Flavor of most of the dishes and dipping sauces were fantastic.  Prices were very reasonable.  I won't be back because of the manager on duty Friday night.  He was so rude to us but over the top friendly to other diners around us.   I guess he didn't like us?

Wttzc0jTFq8J33MgRRZrwA.text: Food and drinks were excellent, our waitress was helpful in explaining things on the menu. Our server however needed some training don't reach across another person to serve. Will definitely be going back.

TcgSeuDJqXpR0VStBwmGag.text: CO is one of my favorite solo spots. Every time I've come the staff is friendly and professional. I haven't come when they were super busy but the service is prompt and the food always comes out hot and fresh. The menu is extensive enough to make choosing difficult but in a good way. Everything sounds amazing. I say sounds since I tend to stick to the Ahi Poke (my original reason for hitting it up) and their crab wontons are the best I've ever had. I also really appreciate the music they play, especially since I'm usually alone. I even heard a Miniature Tigers song once! Maybe next time I can talk myself into trying something new since I'm convinced anything I ordered would be fantastic. I've been a handful of times and have no complaints whatsoever. Highly recommend.

w2ggWjZgVv8pirJvwEKdHA.text: Amazing food and service.  Shopping center is gorgeous .

6HqPmwS1XiWcYxypkbHT8Q.text: Unfortunate service snafus ruin good cuisine. On a Sunday eve there was no manager on site just a disinterested hostess. The kitchen or waiter forgot two of our dishes but when we finally got them the food was 4 star worthy. Hopefully, upper mgt will take note of the disastrous service reviews on Yelp and turn this restaurant around.

jDiv0UufR3NV3D6SPoRTZg.text: The place is well decorated, warm & friendly ... Food was excellent -- but if you have an allergy WATCH THE MENU carefully! My adult son has a peanut & tree nut allergy, and we didn't notice the little red peanut symbol next to the Spicy Beef Pho he ordered. He had an allergic reaction about 30 minutes after we left, and we had to dose him up with Benadryl. Thankfully, he's fine, but we had NO IDEA that anything he ingested had peanuts in it. I do wish the menu was more blatant about things that contain peanuts -- it was not listed in the description of the item, just had a little red peanut symbol next to it. Our server was lackluster, but the person who brought us our food was great. I will definitely go back but will watch the menu more carefully.

i2RxGrCt8RV3FSwJEC90ag.text: I was there for lunch. Decoration, atmosphere, everything awesome.  Food, ennn.. not good. I can tell from the menu it is an Asian fusion restaurant, not traditional. That is fine. But the food, itself, cold, mushy, salty. The food and sauce doesn't match.
